questions.question: Which of the following was a long-term cause of World War I involving the buildup of armed forces?
The Triple Entente, formed before the war, consisted of which three nations?
What region was known as the 'Powder Keg of Europe' prior to 1914?
The immediate spark that triggered World War I was the assassination of:
The assassin of the Austro-Hungarian heir, Gavrilo Princip, was a member of which nationalist group?
Germany's strategy to avoid a two-front war by quickly defeating France first was known as the:
Which country made the first declaration of war in 1914?
The Western Front was characterized primarily by:
The territory between opposing trenches was commonly referred to as:
Which battle in 1914 halted the German advance into France and ruined the Schlieffen Plan?
Which new weapon was first introduced by the Germans at the Second Battle of Ypres?
Which nation switched sides in 1915, leaving the Triple Alliance to join the Allies?
The British passenger liner sunk by a German U-boat in 1915, killing 128 Americans, was the:
What was the primary purpose of the Gallipoli Campaign?

options.A: To invade Germany through the North Sea
options.C: To open a supply route to Russia through the Dardanelles

questions.question: The longest and costliest battle of the war, fought in 1916, was the:
Which country withdrew from the war in 1917 following a domestic revolution?
The secret telegram from Germany to Mexico promising US territory in exchange for an alliance was the:
The United States entered World War I primarily due to:
What was the name of the peace plan proposed by US President Woodrow Wilson?
An armistice ending the fighting was signed on which date?
Which treaty officially ended the war between the Allies and Germany?
Under the Treaty of Versailles, Germany was forced to accept the 'War Guilt Clause', also known as:
As a result of the war, which empire was completely dissolved and replaced by several new nations?
The international organization created after WWI to maintain world peace was the:
Which nation was forced to pay massive financial reparations after the war?
Who was the leader of the Bolsheviks during the 1917 Russian Revolution?
The use of propaganda during WWI was intended to:

options.A: Encourage people to support the war effort
options.B: Teach soldiers how to use new weapons
options.C: Share military secrets with the enemy

questions.question: The policy of glorifying power and keeping an army prepared for war is:
Which country was NOT a member of the 'Big Four' at the Paris Peace Conference?
The 'Mandate System' established after the war was essentially:

options.A: A plan for immediate independence for all colonies
options.B: A way for the Allies to manage former German and Ottoman territories
options.C: An agreement to ban chemical weapons
options.D: A trade union between Europe and Asia

questions.question: The term 'Total War' means that:

options.A: Nations devote all their resources to the war effort
options.B: Only soldiers are affected by the war
options.C: The war is fought only on land

questions.question: Which battle was the only major naval engagement of World War I?
Self-determination, a key point in Wilsonâ€™s 14 Points, meant that:

options.A: People should decide for themselves what government they wish to have
options.B: The USA would decide the borders of Europe
options.D: Large nations should rule small nations

questions.question: The 'Sick Man of Europe' was a nickname for which declining empire?
What was the result of the Treaty of Brest-Litovsk?

options.C: Russia ended its participation in WWI

questions.question: Which of these nations was created from Austro-Hungarian territory after WWI?
Rationing was a system designed to:

options.A: Limit the purchase of consumer goods to ensure enough for the military
options.C: Encourage people to eat more meat
options.D: Provide free clothes to the poor

questions.question: The industrialization of war in WWI led to:

options.C: Mass production of weapons and high death tolls
options.D: The end of the factory system

questions.question: Which country suffered the highest total number of casualties in WWI?
The 'War of Attrition' refers to a strategy of:

options.A: Winning by wearing down the enemy's men and resources
options.C: Using peace talks to delay fighting

questions.question: Which monarch was forced to abdicate in Germany at the end of the war?
The newly independent Poland was given access to the sea through the:
What role did women play on the home front during the war?

options.A: They replaced men in factories and offices
options.C: They were sent to the front lines as combat soldiers
options.D: They took over the government leadership

questions.question: The Treaty of Versailles required Germany to return Alsace-Lorraine to:
Which of the following was a result of the war's end?

options.A: The spread of the Spanish Flu pandemic
options.B: The immediate end of all global conflicts
options.C: Economic boom for all European nations

questions.question: The term 'Doughboys' was a nickname for:
What was the significance of the Battle of Tannenberg?

options.A: It was a major German victory over Russia on the Eastern Front
options.B: It was the first time tanks were used
options.C: It ended the war in Turkey
options.D: It led to the surrender of Italy

questions.question: The 'Blank Check' refers to:

options.B: Germany's promise of unconditional support to Austria-Hungary

questions.question: Which weapon made crossing 'No Man's Land' extremely difficult?
The ultimate failure of the League of Nations was largely due to:

options.A: The refusal of the United States to join
options.D: The lack of a common language
